From " Day ", " who " sound. The original meaning is hot. "Shu Wen": "Summer, heat. From the sun, the voice." Duan Yucai's note: "Summer and heat are one word, so Xu teaches heat with heat. Analysis of words is two... It is called dampness, and the meaning of heat is dryness. Therefore, hot summer is also called wet summer." Such as "Mozi. "Gongmeng": "Today I ask why it is a room, saying that it is to avoid the cold in winter and avoid the heat in summer." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "The Japanese Book A Type" Jian 50 Back One: "The summer is hot, the room is not (without) the cold for the reason, but the young (dragon) is at it."

" Summer " also means the hot season. Such as "Zhou Yi. "Xi Ci Xi": "The cold goes, the summer comes, and the summer goes, the cold comes, and the cold and the heat defer to each other and the year becomes Yan." "Lie Zi. "Tang Question": "The beginning of the cold and summer season changes."

" Summer " is a term in traditional Chinese medicine, which is one of the "six kinks". "Su Wen. It is really important to talk about it: "A husband who lives with all diseases is born in wind, cold, heat, dampness, dryness, and fire." Too much of these six climates or conditions can lead to illness.

humanum_full_description:
從「日」，「者」聲。本義是炎熱。《說文》：「暑，熱也。从日，者聲。」段玉裁注：「暑與熱渾言則一，故許以熱訓暑。析言則二。……暑之義主謂溼，熱之義主謂燥。故溽暑謂溼暑也。」如《墨子．公孟》：「今我問曰何故為室，曰冬避寒焉，夏避暑焉。」《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡50背壹：「夏大暑，室毋（無）故而寒，幼蠪（龍）處之。」

　　「暑」又表示炎熱的季節。如《周易．繫辭下》：「寒往則暑來，暑往則寒來，寒暑相推而歲成焉。」《列子．湯問》：「寒暑易節，始一反焉。」

　　「暑」是中醫學名詞，屬於「六淫」之一。《素問．至真要大論》：「夫百病之生也，皆生於風、寒、暑、濕、燥、火。」此六種氣候或狀態太過，就會導致生病。

Radicals: 日, 者  (sun, someone)
Meaning Mnemonic
When someone goes out in the sun, they get hot. That’s just how it is. Someone standing out in the sun for a long time will inevitably get hot. The sun is hot, and it makes you get hot too.
Imagine you are this someone, standing out in the hot sun. Feel the sun’s hot rays beating down on you as you stand outside. The hot sun makes you start to sweat and you get all sweaty and sticky from the heat. Note that this usually refers to the hot weather or the heat of an area you're in and doesn't refer to a hot "thing."
Reading Mnemonic
You need to get out of this hot sun and into some air conditioning. Then you remember there’s a great air conditioning unit at Suzie’s (あつ) house. Ah, Suzie – our savior! If you need me, I’ll be at Suzie’s place.
Imagine that great feeling when you go from hot and sticky outside to nice and air conditioned inside. Feel the heat transition on your skin as you step into an air conditioned room at Suzie’s. It gives you goose bumps.
